page.title: 05RELIGION IN THE AREA
page.content: Chiddingly and Golden Cross are multi-faith areas. The people follow different religions but the most common ones are the Church of England and Roman Catholic. There are also a few Non-conformists and Baptists. There is a Parish church at both Upper Dicker and Chiddingly which are both Church of England. These are the most local as Golden Cross does not have it's own church. Chiddingly church was built about 700 years ago. It has a tower and a spire which was built in the 15th century. The spire was built from local stones. The church is now in the process of restoration. The Upper Dicker church is used extensively by St.Bede's School and is twinned with Hellingly Parish church.
